title: Tensor-Based Regression Learning: Foundations and Applications for Language Modeling

context.prior_knowledge: Basic machine learning concepts, foundational linear algebra, and introductory understanding of natural language processing (NLP) along with basic grammar and lexical analysis capabilities
context.additional_context: Emphasizes practical language modeling application skills through hands-on education. Combines theoretical explanations with simple text data computation exercises due to technological constraints. Considers linguistic contexts such as vocabulary/grammar structure analysis, text representation, and contextual meaning interpretation.

learning_goals: Explain the fundamental principles of tensor-based regression learning and compare its differences from ELM (Extreme Learning Machine) in natural language processing, focusing on text structure and vocabulary usage.
Solve simple regression problems in text data (e.g., word frequency prediction and contextual semantic analysis) by applying the Moore-Penrose pseudoinverse calculation method for tensors.

Understand the integration of Type-2 fuzzy sets into tensor regression models and apply them to address uncertainties in linguistic data (e.g., polysemy handling and context-dependent semantic interpretation).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
